Message.Title: Modern stock trading for 19th century creeky
Message.Msg: Every ms for every stock in the S+P a valuation for a share is calculated by the computer trading systems. Lets say this metric ranges from -100 to 100. -100 indicates sell it all NOW. +100 buy all you can get NOW. This runs every ms (milli second for creek ) that the market is open. Now here is the tough part for 19th century creek. Neither buying nor selling means the algorithm has no clear indication -> metric between say -10 - +10. In the computer age low volume == agreement on price, NOT that a price can be 'pushed' because 'no one is watching'. Remember if the stock starts to become mispriced the computer buys.. Now i suppose you are going to bring up that crap about wall street shutting off the algorithms to go take lunch, letting millions of dollars of profit sit on the table while they eat a hamburger. I simply do not believe this happens.

Message.Title: Craper forgets all about Obama outscouring of taxpayer money and jobs
Message.Msg: They need to runs ads about this over and over because the Craper whiners evidently haven't heard about this. At least Romney didn't do it with taxpayer money. Electric Cars Obama handed over billions of dollars in loan guarantees and stimulus awards pursuant to his goal of putting one-million electric vehicles on the road by 2015. Much of that money ended up leaving our shores. A $2.4 billion stimulus program to support battery production sent nearly half of its money to foreign firms, including two South Korean companies that used their awards to hire foreign nationals in Michigan to do work that Americans easily could have done. In the end, despite all the money Obama handed out, electric vehicle sales have lagged and The Washington Post deemed his goal of one million electric cars "overly optimistic." Wind Farms Obama's stimulus included over $8.5 billion in grants for wind farms that flowed overseas, despite Congressional criticism from both sides of the aisle. In total, over half of the money went to either foreign developers or foreign wind turbine manufacturers, creating thousands of jobs overseas with money that was supposed to create jobs within the United States. Even worse, hundreds of millions of dollars went to wind farms that began construction before the stimulus was passed. The end result of all this spending: the wind energy industry lost 10,000 jobs last year. Manufacturing TaxCredits As Obama was doling out over $2.3 billion in clean energy manufacturing tax credits that were supposed to create jobs in America, $880 million went to foreign firms. Worse still, some of those same recipients are now closing up shop and shipping jobs overseas. Loan Guarantees Remember Solyndra? The problems with Obama's loan guarantee program don't end there. The largest recipient of Obama's program to jumpstart green energy projects was the Spanish Company Abengoa, which took in $2.7 billion in loan guarantees for three of its projects. Other projects importing foreign-made solar panels are, much in the same way as Fisker Automotive, choosing to make their products overseas.

Message.Title: "Mood disorders" are running rampant among liberals
Message.Msg: (CNSNews.com) - The Social Security Administration released its annual statistical report on federal disability insurance last month, revealing that at the end of 2011 there was a then-record of 8,575,544 workers collecting federal disability benefits and among them were 1,304,851 doing so because they suffered from “mood disorders.” Massachusetts led the 50 states for disabling mood disorders. In that state, 22.8 percent of disability beneficiaries had been diagnosed with a mood disorder. New Hampshire was second with 22.2 percent, and Rhode Island was third with 20.7 percent. In each month since December 2011, SSA has reported, the overall number of Americans collecting disability has continued to rise. In August, according to SSA, a record 8,767,941 American workers collected disability. Also, in addition to the 8,767,941 workers collecting disability payments, there were 1,853,651 eligible children of disabled workers collecting additional benefits and 164,651 eligible spouses of disabled workers collecting benefits—bringing the total number of disability beneficiaries in August to 10,786,510. It looks like it is the liberals who are bankrupting social security. Definitly sounds like Craper's problem......hum...mood disorder

Message.Title: Of course, this guy is not as smart as Craper
Message.Msg: Jim Rogers: It's Going To Get Really "Bad After The Next Election" In a riveting interview on CNBC, legendary investor Jim Rogers warned Americans to prepare for "Financial Armageddon," saying he fully expects the economy to implode after the U.S. election. Rogers, who for years has been an outspoken critic of the Feds policies of "Quantitative Easing," says the world is "drowning in too much debt." He put the blame squarely on U.S. and European governments for abusing their "license to print money." In the U.S. alone, the national debt has surged to nearly $16 trillion, that's more than $50,000 for every American man, woman and child. "[They] need to stop spending money they don't have," Rogers said. "The solution to too much debt is not more debt... What would make me very excited is if a few people [in the government] went bankrupt..." Rogers added. Rogers also charged Obama and German Chancellor Angela Merkel with promoting dangerous policies that create the illusion the economy is stable... but are really only intended to buy time before their upcoming elections. Do these charts and graphs prove that the Obama Administration’s current economic path is headed for disaster? "Mrs. Merkle has an election next year," Rogers said. "Mr. Obama has an election in November. The Americans and the Germans - they want to do everything they can to hold the world up until after the next election." "It's going to be bad after the next election." In a newly released documentary that went viral last month, a team of influential economic experts say they have discovered a "frightening pattern" they believe points to a massive economic catastrophe unlike anything ever seen in the history of the world

Topic.Title: Who is responsible for outsourcing jobs?

Message.Msg: /We all are. Every time you buy a cheap Chinese substitute where an American quality alternate exists, you are sending jobs overseas/ that was started 24 years ago or more but you're right. Go to costco, even that furniture is made in china. vanities, faucets, shoes, tools, most everything in the store except the live plants and food. now there is almost no choice. Go to thrift shops to find your usa made items. There's your loss of manufacturing jobs, and worse, the transfer of know how.
